episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and historical topics, including Beethoven's DNA analysis, the humorous name of a Scottish illustrator, a French philosopher's bizarre theory about human descent from frogs, and a pig's nomination as a US presidential candidate by a prankster political group.

facts.fact: According to DNA analysis, Beethoven wasn't very musical.
One of Scotland's most eminent 19th century illustrators was called Willie Hull.
The title "Prince of Thinkers" was awarded in France to a philosopher whose greatest published work claimed humans were descended from frogs.
In 1968, a pig was nominated as a US presidential candidate, but was arrested in the middle of his acceptance speech.
